text: Guys we started javascript in web development Today I am going to tell you how to make variables in javascript So what I am going to do here is I made 47 videos here So I am going to make 48 video here So I will make 48 file here Tute48.html Ok And after making this Tute48 I told you how to write javascript in browser We discussed all those things in 47th video What we are going to do here We will see in 48th video How we will write our javascript in boilerplate So what I will do here is I will close the other tabs And I will tell you here How we can write our javascript by adding script tag And after adding script tag We can give src="file path and we can include javascript there Here I will use the first method And I will write javascript here So here I am going to write div.container And I will write h1 here This is a heading And along with that I will write div.content And after that I will write paragraph So that I can see some content And as soon as I will go live You will see this opening in live server And I will open it here And here you can see this is a heading And here I want to tell you How to make variables in javascript And how we can open the console And see all the output So we have discussed Sometimes there is an error of favicon If you have not put favicon And we will talk about it later If you will reload the page This error will be gone And ignore this error for now If you are getting If you want to make a variable in javascript So you can do this by putting var a=" And the content of the variable Variables are just like containers Which store data Now here the variable I have made a="78 It is storing a number Along with that I can write var b=" And I can write a string When I put double quote It is for string And here I have written b="Harry Now here I will do console.log a So I will see a here As you can see I can see 78 And if I save it as console.log b Then I can see Harry here But if I do console.log c Then I will get an error It will say c is not there So I hope you have understood this thing Along with that Here in javascript We will see operators Now here if you are a web developer And do not want to go into too much programming Initially in its initial stage I believe that you are Do not go into programming too much Because if you go into too much programming Then your main web development funda You will not be able to move forward with strong That's why I am saying Data structures and object orientation Do not go into all these things initially Learn to make a basic website first And after that I do not refuse to go to the advanced level So here we saw How to make variables Now here it was variables Here we made an integer variable And here we made a string B is equal to string Now what we will do here The variable we made b is equal to It was a string So its data type was string And its data type was integer Now here we do not need to tell JavaScript That we have to make an integer or make a string It automatically took what we gave So 78 was an integer Harry was a string We did not tell him this We fed our JavaScript So here it is called dynamic typing So what does dynamic typing mean? Dynamic typing means You do not need to type So the way we made all these things here I did not define c here But if I make c equal to 34.55 So here it is 34.55 Now the way I printed the values for you Similarly, I tell you about operators Operators in JavaScript Now let's see what are the operators in JavaScript There are three types of operators One is our unary operator The second is binary operator And the third is not an operator It is an operand It is a term So I will keep only two types of operators here And you guys along with this Operand See what is operand So it is a unary operator That operator which works on only one operand What does operand mean? If I write minus 2 here If I write it like this 3 plus 4 I write 3 plus 4 In 3 plus 4 Plus is the operator And 3 or 4 is our operands So 3, 4 are operands And plus is the operator So this way you guys Operand and operator I hope you understood the difference The 3 plus 4 which has a value of 7 In 7 plus operator works And 3 and 4 are operands Here I will write Entities on which operators operate And what is unary operator? Unary operator is It has single operand Like If you write minus And after that you write minus 0 Now you write minus 98 So this is our unary operator Now here Your x value was 5 So you wrote x is equal to Minus x So x will be negative So you wrote x Now you write it in minus So we have applied unary negation operator So let's take an example Of unary operator So I wrote C is equal to minus C So here I will copy it And I will write here Unary operator in action example Of unary operator Ok Here you can see Minus 34.55 was printed Why it happened? Because I wrote C is equal to minus C So first my 34.55 will be printed And then in minus it will be printed So I hope you understood unary operator Like that we have Binary operators And here we have two operands Exactly two operands And x is equal to x plus 6 If I write it like this So I will have binary operator So I hope you understood What is binary operator Let's take an example Of binary operator Binary operator Example of binary operator C is equal to 456 plus 8 And 456 plus 8 is 464 And see my 464 Will be printed I didn't print it And here you can write semicolon Now you must have seen When I am not writing semicolon JavaScript forgives us And it doesn't Throw us error So JavaScript is a forgiving language And the reason is It is used in browser And it doesn't want to throw you error So it is a forgiving language So this was the example of binary operator Now binary operator is not necessary To be applied on numbers It can be applied on your string So let me do one thing I
